this file is only 405Mb. How can I play this on my wii. I have a usb HDD.
Do i need to download any other software?

The file is 405MB because I "scrubbed" it. Meaning, I used a program to delete all the superfluous dummy data that the Wii requires of the disc. The game data is only 405MB, but the iso is 4.59GB (or whatever) because the discs are that size. You'll notice that the file you downloaded is a rar. Unrar and you'll get an iso that is 4.59GB (or whatever). To use USB loaders, they format the HDD to a specific format that Windows can't read. You need a program that can work in that format and transfer isos to the HDD's special USB loader partition.

However, it not my prerogative to help you beyond that.

@bteljuice As far a Wii backup ISO files that have been extracted by USBloader programs such as WiiFlow or USBLoaderGX the sizes vary. I know that Super Smash Bros Brawl is a 6 Gig game whereas Super Mario Bros Wii only takes up a couple hundred Megabytes. It works the same way as PC games do. All games take up different amounts of space. ;D

You need to use DVD-R if you have an older Wii. Burnt discs don't work on the newer ones (not sure when exactly as mine is a launch Wii).

This works fine on CFG loader as far as I know should work on any properly set up Wii/emulator. Make sure you can run NTSC region.
